nodes.label: Claim: The minimum voting age should be lowered to 16.
Premise: 16-year-olds are old enough to make informed decisions.
Conclusion: 16-year-olds should be allowed to vote.
Counter-claim: Lowering the voting age would lead to less informed voting.
Premise: 16-year-olds lack the life experience and knowledge to make informed decisions.
Conclusion: Lowering the voting age would lead to less informed voting.
Rebuttal: Lowering the voting age could actually increase political engagement among young people.
Premise: Lowering the voting age would send a message that young people are valued and their voices matter.
Conclusion: Lowering the voting age could actually increase political engagement among young people.
